member.returns: The media types that the user selected when answering the call.

member.summary: Gets the current state of the VoIP call.
member.returns: The current state of the VOIP call.

member.summary: Supports the NotifyMuted and NotifyUnmuted events.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipCallCoordinator
member.summary: Allows an application to manage VoIP calls.

member.name: E:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipCallCoordinator.MuteStateChanged
member.summary: Raised when the mute status for the phone call changes.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipCallCoordinator.CancelUpgrade(System.Guid)
member.summary: Cancels the upgrade to a VoIP call.
member.param: The GUID for the VoIP call.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipCallCoordinator.GetDefault
member.summary: Retrieves the default instance of the VoipCallCoordinator class.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipCallCoordinator.NotifyMuted
member.summary: Notifies the system that the user has muted the call using the VoIP app's UI.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipCallCoordinator.NotifyUnmuted
member.summary: Notifies the system that the user has unmuted the call using the VoIP app's UI.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipCallCoordinator.RequestIncomingUpgradeToVideoCall(System.String,System.String,System.String,Windows.Foundation.Uri,System.String,Windows.Foundation.Uri,System.String,Windows.Foundation.Uri,Windows.Foundation.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Makes a request to the system for an incoming video call that will replace an existing call.
member.param: A string that is passed to the associated foreground app as a deep link. This might be a contact name or other data that can be used to populate the app's UI more quickly. The maximum length is 128 characters. This parameter must be non-null and must refer to a task defined in the app's manifest file.
The contact name of the caller to be displayed on the incoming call UI. The maximum length is 128 characters.
The phone number of the caller to be displayed on the incoming call UI. The maximum length is 128 characters.
The Uri of an image file associated with the caller to be displayed on the incoming call UI. The file type must be PNG or JPG. The maximum file size is 1 MB.
The name of the VoIP service or application. The maximum length is 128 characters.
The Uri of an image file that is a logo or icon of the VoIP service or application to be displayed on the incoming call UI. The file type must be PNG or JPG. The maximum file size is 128 KB.
A string indicating who the call is on behalf of. The maximum length is 128 characters.
The Uri of an audio file containing the ringtone for this call. The file type must be WMA or MP3. The maximum file size is 1 MB.
The time, in seconds, the system should wait for the user to answer or ignore the call before rejecting the call. The allowed range is 5 to 120 seconds. The default value is 30 seconds.
member.returns: The object representing the new incoming call.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipCallCoordinator.RequestNewAppInitiatedCall(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipPhoneCallMedia)
member.summary: Requests a new call object from the system. Call this method from your VoIP app to tell the system that there's a new incoming call, and that you want to host an incoming call notification for that new call.
member.param: A string that is passed to the associated foreground app as a deep link. The maximum length is 128 characters. This parameter must be non-null.
The contact name of the caller to be displayed on the incoming call UI. The maximum length is 128 characters.
The phone number of the caller to be displayed on the incoming call UI. The maximum length is 128 characters.
The name of the VoIP service or application. The maximum length is 128 characters.

The media types of the new incoming call (either audio and video or audio only). Pass **Audio|Video** if the user should have the option of answering the call with outgoing video. This assumes that the user's device has a camera available for the app to use at the time the call arrives. If this is not the case, or the user should only use audio, pass **Audio**.
member.returns: The object representing the new initiated call.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipCallCoordinator.RequestNewIncomingCall(System.String,System.String,System.String,Windows.Foundation.Uri,System.String,Windows.Foundation.Uri,System.String,Windows.Foundation.Uri,Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipPhoneCallMedia,Windows.Foundation.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Makes a request to the system for a new incoming call.
member.param: A string that is passed to the associated foreground app as a deep link. The maximum length is 128 characters. This parameter must be non-null.
The contact name of the caller to be displayed on the incoming call UI. The maximum length is 128 characters.
The phone number of the caller to be displayed on the incoming call UI. The maximum length is 128 characters.
The Uri of an image file associated with the caller to be displayed on the incoming call UI. The file type must be PNG or JPG. The maximum file size is 1MB.
The name of the VoIP service or application. The maximum length is 128 characters.
The Uri of an image file that is a logo or icon of the VoIP service or application to be displayed on the incoming call UI. The file type must be PNG or JPG. The maximum file size is 128KB.
A string indicating who the call is on behalf of. The maximum length is 128 characters.
The Uri of an audio file containing the ringtone for this call. The file type must be WMA or MP3. The maximum file size is 1MB.

The media types of the new incoming call (either audio and video or audio only). Pass **Audio|Video** if the user should have the option of answering the call with outgoing video. This assumes that the user's device has a camera available for the app to use at the time the call arrives. If this is not the case, or the user should only use audio, pass **Audio**.
The time, in seconds, the system should wait for the user to answer or ignore the call before rejecting the call. The allowed range is 5 to 120 seconds. The default value is 30 seconds.
member.returns: The object representing the new incoming call.

member.summary: Makes a request to the system for a new incoming call.
member.param: A string that is passed to the associated foreground app as a deep link. The maximum length is 128 characters. This parameter must be non-null.
The contact name of the caller to be displayed on the incoming call UI. The maximum length is 128 characters.
The phone number of the caller to be displayed on the incoming call UI. The maximum length is 128 characters.
The Uri of an image file associated with the caller to be displayed on the incoming call UI. The file type must be PNG or JPG. The maximum file size is 1MB.
The name of the VoIP service or application. The maximum length is 128 characters.
The Uri of an image file that is a logo or icon of the VoIP service or application to be displayed on the incoming call UI. The file type must be PNG or JPG. The maximum file size is 128KB.
A string indicating who the call is on behalf of. The maximum length is 128 characters.
The Uri of an audio file containing the ringtone for this call. The file type must be WMA or MP3. The maximum file size is 1MB.

The media types of the new incoming call (either audio and video or audio only). Pass **Audio|Video** if the user should have the option of answering the call with outgoing video. This assumes that the user's device has a camera available for the app to use at the time the call arrives. If this is not the case, or the user should only use audio, pass **Audio**.
The time, in seconds, the system should wait for the user to answer or ignore the call before rejecting the call. The allowed range is 5 to 120 seconds. The default value is 30 seconds.
The contact remote ID of the caller. The maximum length is 256 characters.
member.returns: The object representing the new incoming call.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipCallCoordinator.RequestNewOutgoingCall(System.String,System.String,System.String,Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipPhoneCallMedia)
member.summary: Makes a request to the system for a new outgoing call.
member.param: A string that is passed to the associated foreground app as a deep link. The maximum length is 128 characters. This parameter must be non-null.
The name or ID of the caller which is displayed in the phone's minimized call UI. The maximum length is 128 characters.
The name of the VoIP service which is displayed in the phone's minimized call UI. The maximum length is 128 characters.

The media type of the new outgoing call (either audio and video or audio only). Pass **Audio|Video** if the user chose to start the call with outgoing video. This assumes that the user's device has a camera available for the app to use at the time the call is made. If this is not the case, or the user should only use audio, pass **Audio**.
member.returns: The object representing the new outgoing call.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipCallCoordinator.RequestOutgoingUpgradeToVideoCall(System.Guid,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Makes a request of the system to create an outgoing video call that will replace an existing cellular call.
member.param: The GUID of the call.

A string that is passed to the associated foreground app as a deep link. This might be a contact name or other data that can be used to populate the app's UI more quickly. The maximum length is 128 characters. This parameter must be non-null and must refer to a task defined in the app's manifest file.
The name or ID of the caller which is displayed in the phone's minimized call UI. The maximum length is 128 characters.
The name of the VoIP service which is displayed in the phone's minimized call UI. The maximum length is 128 characters.
member.returns: The object representing the new outgoing call.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipCallCoordinator.ReserveCallResourcesAsync
member.summary: Reserves the CPU and memory resources necessary for a VoIP call. You should use this method only in a single-process application model.
member.returns: The result of the reservation action.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipCallCoordinator.ReserveCallResourcesAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Reserves the CPU and memory resources necessary for a VoIP call. You should use this method only in a two-process application model.
member.param: The name of an application-defined class that performs the work of a background task. For more information, see TaskEntryPoint.
member.returns: The result of the reservation action.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipCallCoordinator.SetupNewAcceptedCall(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipPhoneCallMedia)
member.summary: Sets up a newly accepted call.
member.param: Information that is passed to the VoIP app's foreground UI process. This might be the contact name, or other data that helps the UI display more quickly.
The name or ID of the caller.
The phone number (if applicable) of the caller.
The name of the service or application.

The media types of the new incoming call (either audio and video or audio only). Pass **Audio|Video** if the call should be answered with outgoing video. This assumes that the user's device has a camera available for the app to use at the time the call is answered. If this is not the case, or the user should only use audio, pass **Audio**.
member.returns: Returns the call as a VoipPhoneCall object.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipCallCoordinator.TerminateCellularCall(System.Guid)
member.summary: Terminates a cellular call in order to upgrade to a VoIP call.
member.param: The GUID for the VoIP call.

member.summary: Represents a VoIP phone call.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipPhoneCall.CallMedia
member.summary: Gets the media types used by the call.
member.returns: The media types used by the call.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipPhoneCall.ContactName
member.summary: Gets or sets contact name associated with the VoIP call.
member.returns: The contact name associated with the VoIP call.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipPhoneCall.StartTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the start time associated with the VoIP call.
member.returns: The start time associated with the call.

member.name: E:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipPhoneCall.AnswerRequested
member.summary: Raised when the user answers an incoming call.

member.name: E:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipPhoneCall.EndRequested
member.summary: Raised to alert the VoIP app that the call should be ended.

member.name: E:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipPhoneCall.HoldRequested
member.summary: Raised to alert the VoIP app that the call should be placed on hold.

member.name: E:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipPhoneCall.RejectRequested
member.summary: Raised when a call has been rejected.

member.name: E:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipPhoneCall.ResumeRequested
member.summary: Raised to indicate that a previously held VoIP call should be made active.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipPhoneCall.NotifyCallAccepted(Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipPhoneCallMedia)
member.summary: Notifies the system that the VoIP call has been accepted.
member.param: The media types of the new incoming call (either audio and video or audio only). Pass **Audio|Video** if the user chose to answer the call with outgoing video, or **Audio** if they answered with just audio.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipPhoneCall.NotifyCallActive
member.summary: Notifies the system that the VoIP call is active.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipPhoneCall.NotifyCallEnded
member.summary: Notifies the system that the call has ended.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipPhoneCall.NotifyCallHeld
member.summary: Notifies the system that the call is currently on hold.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipPhoneCall.NotifyCallReady
member.summary: When upgrading a call from cellular to video, notifies the system that the app is done setting up the audio and video streams for the video call so that the system can end the existing cellular call.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipPhoneCall.TryShowAppUI
member.summary: Brings the VOIP app's user interface into the foreground after accepting a call.

member.summary: Specifies the media types used by a VoIP call.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipPhoneCallMedia.None
member.summary: The call uses no media.

member.summary: The call uses video.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipPhoneCallRejectReason

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipPhoneCallRejectReason.EmergencyCallExists
member.summary: An emergency call is in progress.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipPhoneCallRejectReason.InvalidCallState
member.summary: The call is in an invalid state.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipPhoneCallRejectReason.OtherIncomingCall
member.summary: Another incoming call was accepted.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipPhoneCallRejectReason.TimedOut
member.summary: The incoming call timed out.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipPhoneCallRejectReason.UserIgnored
member.summary: The user pressed a button to ignore the call.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipPhoneCallResourceReservationStatus
member.summary: Indicates the result of attempting to reserve VoIP resources.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipPhoneCallResourceReservationStatus.ResourcesNotAvailable
member.summary: The resources were not reserved because they are not available.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipPhoneCallResourceReservationStatus.Success
member.summary: The resources have been reserved.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipPhoneCallState
member.summary: Specifies the state of a VoIP call.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipPhoneCallState.Active
member.summary: The call is active.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipPhoneCallState.Ended
member.summary: The call has ended.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.VoipPhoneCallState.Held
member.summary: The call is on hold.
